rsb.true_desc: The user shoots a bundle of leaves in the designated direction which explodes on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

upgrades.name: Pollen Puff
upgrades.description1: Throws a Pollen Puff, which attaches to an enemy. The Pollen Puff restores HP for allies and deals damage to enemies.
upgrades.description2: If a Pollen Puff attaches to enemies, it also deals them damage over time. If a Pollen Puff attaches to an ally, it also reduces the damage they receive.

rsb.name: Pollen Puff
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user throws a Pollen Puff at the designated location which attaches to the nearest Pokémon within 0.5s. The Pollen Puff explodes 2s after attaching to a Pokémon, restoring the HP of the user's teammates and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.
rsb.notes: The Pollen Puff explodes on its own after 1s with the same effects if it doesn't attach to any Pokémon within the first 0.5s of landing.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: If the Pollen Puff attaches to a teammate, it reduces the damage that teammate receives by 15% for 2s before it explodes. If the Pollen Puff attaches to any Pokémon, opposing Pokémon that come in contact with the target receive damage over time every 0.5s before the Pollen Puff explodes.

upgrades.name: Leaf Tornado
upgrades.description1: Attack with a tornado of sharp leaves, leaving a path in its wake that increases ally movement speed for a short time.
upgrades.description2: Also decreases the accuracy of enemies for a short time when this move hits.

rsb.name: Leaf Tornado
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: The user launches a tornado of sharp leaves in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by the tornado and creating a path in its wake that lasts for 4s. Teammates on the path have their movement speed increased by 55%, lingering for 1.5s after leaving the path. When the tornado reaches max distance, the tornado damages opposing Pokémon a second time.
rsb.add1_true_desc: 25% of the damage of the first hit.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Applies a debuff to opposing Pokémon hit by the tornado that causes auto attacks to deal no damage for 2.5s.
rsb.enhanced_notes: Effects that only depend on auto attacks hitting and not on auto attacks dealing damge still occur.

skills.name: Synthesis
skills.description: Restores the HP of the user and nearby allies.

rsb.name: Synthesis
rsb.label: Healing
rsb.true_desc: The user uses sunlight to heal themself and teammates in the area of effect.

upgrades.name: Cotton Guard
upgrades.description1: Protects the user and nearby allies with cotton. The cotton absorbs damage and when the move ends, the cotton restores some HP.
upgrades.description2: Also increases the user's movement speed while using this move.

rsb.name: Cotton Guard
rsb.label: Shield
rsb.true_desc: The user grants teammates in the area of effect cotton shields for 3s. After 3s, any cotton leftover is used to restore the HP of teammates with cotton shields for 15% of the remaining shield value.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the movement speed of teammates in the area of effect by 30% for 2s.

upgrades.name: Cotton Spore
upgrades.description1: Gathers spores around the user, increasing the user's movement speed while this move is in effect. The spores burst after a short time, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect, throwing them, and decreasing their movement speed for a short time.
upgrades.description2: Reduced damage taken while using this move.

rsb.name: Cotton Spore
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user gathers spores around them for 2s, increasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. The spores burst at the end, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, throwing them for 0.5s and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s when it hits.
rsb.notes: Cotton Cloud Crash can be used during this move, ending the move early and making the spores burst immediately.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 40% for 2s.

skills.name: Cotton Cloud Crash
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Float into the air and become invincible. If used again, pound the ground, attacking and shoving enemies and restoring HP to allies in the area of effect.

rsb.name: Cotton Cloud Crash
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user becomes invincible as they float into the air for up to 3s, moving freely over obstacles and increasing their movement speed by 10% while in the air. If used again or after 3s, the user pounds the ground, restoring the HP of the user and teammates in the area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoving opposing Pokémon hit for 0.7s.

name: Espeon

builds.name: Shock Beam
builds.explanation: Curse Incense should replace Wise Glasses if enemy has kit recovery or healers.

builds.name: Stored Beam
builds.explanation: Curse Incense should replace Wise Glasses if enemy has kit recovery or healers.

builds.name: Shock Sight
builds.explanation: Curse Incense should replace Wise Glasses if enemy has kit recovery or healers.

builds.name: Stored Sight
builds.explanation: Curse Incense should replace Wise Glasses if enemy has kit recovery or healers.

notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Espeon has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels. When on a team with four other eeveelutions, gains +1% base Special Attack.

skills.name: Anticipation
skills.description: When Eevee would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and Eevee becomes immune to hindrances for a short time (35s cd). Note: Hindrances include slows; multi-layered hindrance moves such as Pikachu's Volt Tackle will only have the very first launch negated.
skills.passive2_description: When Espeon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and Espeon becomes immune to hindrances for a short time. At the same time, this ability deals damage to the enemy that attempted to inflict the hindrance and applies a 30% slow for 1s (35s cd). Note: Hindrances include slows; multi-layered hindrance moves such as Pikachu's Volt Tackle will only have the very first launch negated.

skills.name: Attack - Eevee
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.
skills.basic2_description: Becomes a boosted attack whenever a set amount of time passes (5s cd), firing a beam in front of the user. The beam deals increased damage and decreases the movement speed of targets hit by 30% for 1s.

rsb.name: Swift
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: Eevee launches three stars at target location. Stars start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Eevee's facing. Stars continue to fly in the direction once past the target location until the maximum range is reached. When an enemy is hit by a star, subsequent stars deal 70% less damage.

rsb.name: Psyshock
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: Espeon materializes psychic projectiles and launches them at a designated location; dealing damage to enemies hit by the projectiles and decreasing their movement speed for each projectile hit by 15% for 3s (maximum 75%). Orbs start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Espeon's facing and continue flying in the  designated direction until the maximum range of the move. Targets hit by all five projectiles are stunned for 1.25s. When an enemy is hit by a projectile, subsequent projectiles deal 70% less damage. When Psyshock is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it launches stronger psychic projectiles at a designated location. These projectiles at their point of convergence cause an explosion, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. There is no damage increase.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increase the speed at which projectiles travel.

rsb.name: Stored Power
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: Unleash blasts of psychic power at random enemies within an area; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed from each projectile hit by 10% for 2s (maximum 50%). Espeon stores one blast of psychic power every 2s (unaffected by cooldown reduction), or after hitting an enemy with a boosted attack (gaining 1 stored blast per enemy hit). Up to five blasts can be stored at once. After this move is used, Espeon's movement speed is increased by 70% for 1.2s. Targets hit by a psychic blast will take 70% less damage from subsequent hits. When Stored Power is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it unleashes an increased number of psychic blasts (8 total) and restores Espeon's HP by 150 per blast.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Also deals additional damage to enemies below 50% max HP.

rsb.name: Growl
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Growl at a designated enemy; dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s.

rsb.name: Psybeam
rsb.label: Damage - Initial
rsb.true_desc: Fires a peculiar ray in the designated direction. If the beam hits an enemy, it will then split beyond the first enemy hit and deal damage to other enemies in range. The initial enemy hit and these split rays deal more damage based on the max HP of the first enemy hit by the ray. If the first enemy hit by the ray is slowed or is stunned, those same effects will be applied to the enemies hit by the split rays. The split rays will never go towards Espeon and will refract at a maximum of a 90 degree angle. Distance from initial target to split ray hit is 75% of the max range. Stun copied duration is the maximum duration of the stun causing the initial Pokémon to be stunned.
rsb.notes: For the split ray, the damage component from the initial target's max HP damage is capped at 1000 against Wild Pokémon and capped at 2000 against Player Pokémon.
rsb.add1_true_desc: 6% max HP of the first enemy hit as additional damage.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Deals additional damage to enemies that are unable to act. If Psybeam hits an unable to act initial target, the split rays will also deal the additional damage to other enemies hit and leaves them unable to act.
rsb.enhanced_notes: Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from max HP is capped at 1000.
rsb.enhanced_add1_true_desc: 5% max HP of the enemy hit as additional damage if the initial target was stunned and if the secondary target can be stunned.

rsb.name: Future Sight
rsb.label: Damage - Initial
rsb.true_desc: Espeon locks-on to an enemy, dealing damage 2 seconds later in an area centered on the locked-on target. Deal more damage based on the locked-on targets missing HP. While locked-on to an enemy, Espeon's other moves will target that enemy whenever possible. If the center of Psyshock is within the area-of-effect of Future Sight when released, Psyshock will home in on the Future Sight affected target. Each time Espeon deals damage to a Future Sight locked-on target through Psyshock, Stored Power, auto attacks, Future Sight's cooldown is reduced by 0.8 seconds. If the locked-on target is an opponent, and is knocked out by Future Sight or by Espeon, then a single powered-up use of Psyshock or Stored Power becomes available for a short time.
rsb.notes: Full Heal and other cleanses such as Blissey's Natural cure remove Future Sight. Against Wild Pokémon: The total damage is capped at 1800.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Espeon deals 10% additional damage to locked-on targets.

skills.name: Psychic Solare
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

rsb.name: Psychic Solare
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Espeon throws enemies in the area of effect into the air and suspends them using psychic power. After a delay, an explosion occurs that deals damage to all enemies in the area of effect and shoves them. Espeon is unstoppable during this move.

name: Falinks
notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike. Falinks' Critical-Hit rate increases at levels 5 and 9.

rsb.name: Battle Armor
rsb.true_desc: The critical-hit modifier of enemies is reduced by 50% when dealing damage to Falinks. Falinks can hold 10 more Aeos Energy than other Pokémon.
rsb.notes: Falinks is a group comprised of the Brass and five Troopers. Each member of the group has a separate hitbox and counts as a different target. The Brass always takes 10% reduced damage. Troopers will take 90% less damage while attached to the Brass. For attacks or moves that can hit multiple targets, the total damage Falinks can take from a single move or attack is 110% of that move or attack's damage.
rsb.rsb_info: Falinks utilize three formations: Column formation, No Retreat formation, and Dispatch formation. When a move is used in No Retreat or Dispatch formation, the effect of the move changes.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, or after the user uses Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head. Boosted attacks also apply a 50% slow for 1s to opposing Pokémon they hit.
rsb.notes: When a boosted attack hits, the cooldown of Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head is reduced by 2.5s

rsb.name: Tackle
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and shoving them. The user's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.

rsb.name: Megahorn
rsb.true_desc: Charge with its horns, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and throwing them in the air for 0.25s. Immediately afterward, strike with its horns again and gain a shield for 2.5s.
rsb.notes: In No Retreat formation: Falinks becomes hindrance resistant and charges power for 1s. It then strikes forward with its horns, dealing additional damage to opposing Pokémon it hits based on their max HP and gaining a shield for 2.5s. This version of the move has a 4s cd that is separate from the column version.
rsb.rsb_info: In Dispatch formation: The Brass will use the column version of Megahorn, the Troopers who are away from the column will use Megahorn too, each striking once in the direction of the target hit by the Brass.
rsb.add4_notes: Deals additional damage equal to 3% of the enemies' max HP. This additional damage is capped at 1000.
rsb.add5_true_desc: Trooper damage becomes additional to Column formation hitting the same target.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the shield value.

rsb.name: Iron Head
rsb.true_desc: Attacks the designated area with its steel-hard heads, dealing damage and applying 50% slow for 1.5s to opposing Pokémon it hits, as well as granting itself a shield.
rsb.notes: In No Retreat formation: The move's range is shortened but the area of effect is widened. Pokémon hit in the landing area are also knocked up and briefly stunned for 0.33s. After using this move, for the next 4 attacks, the user can attack while moving with the Brass and Troops all deal damage separately in front of them.
rsb.rsb_info: In Dispatch formation: When this move is used, the Brass will use the Column version of the move while recalling dispatched Troopers to the Column. The returning Troopers shove and deal damage to opposing Pokémon they hit on their way back to the Column, and give additional shield to Falinks.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Iron Head and the Troopers returning deal an additional 2% max hp damage to enemies they hit, capped to 400.

rsb.name: Bulk Up
rsb.true_desc: Increases the user's Defense, Special Defense and Attack Speed by 25%, and Attack by 30% for 3s

rsb.name: No Retreat
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Switch to No Retreat formation while shoving enemies for 0.4s in front of Falinks and become unstoppable during the formation change for 0.5s. While in No Retreat formation, the user cannot change the direction they're facing, unless they use the other move. Falinks' movement speed when moving backward is slowed by 10%, but Attack is increased by 25% and damage taken from the front is reduced by 20%. If this move is used while the user is in No Retreat formation, the user will switch to Column formation.
rsb.notes: While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 20% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 28%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 92%.
rsb.add1_label: Damage - Brass basic attacks under Iron Head Buffs in No Retreat formation
rsb.add2_label: Damage - Brass boosted attacks under Iron Head Buffs in No Retreat formation
rsb.add3_label: Damage - Trooper basic attacks under Iron Head Buffs in No Retreat formation
rsb.add4_label: Damage - Trooper boosted attacks under Iron Head Buffs in No Retreat formation
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Attack increase is increased to 40% and damage reduction from the front is increased to 30%.
rsb.enhanced_notes: While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 30% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 37%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 93%.

rsb.name: Beat Up
rsb.label: Damage - Charge (x2)
rsb.true_desc: Has the user charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user then switches to Dispatch formation, sending out two Troopers toward enemies that were hit. The dispatched Troopers will continue to attack enemies, but they will return to the Brass after they either: take a set amount of damage, become separated from the Brass by more than a set distance, or after 5s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move with a 0.5s cooldown between each use.
rsb.notes: While in Dispatch formation, the Troopers sent out no longer have any damage resistance nor share damage taken with the Brass. Dispatched Troopers share the same stats as the Brass, except for HP.
rsb.add1_label: Damage - Trooper attacks in Dispatch formation
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Also restores HP when this move hits.

skills.name: Dust Devil Formation
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

rsb.name: Dust Devil Formation
rsb.label: Damage (Per Hit)
rsb.true_desc: Has the five troopers run continuously around the Brass at great speed for 5s, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit by 20% for 1s. Falinks is unstoppable during the formation change for 0.25s. While this move is being used, damage taken by the troopers is reduced. While in Dust Devil formation the Troopers take 30% less damage making the Trooper's total damage reduction 93%.
rsb.notes: Moving clockwise against your target will grant more hits against that target, and counter-clockwise will reduce the number of hits.

name: Garchomp
notes: Only auto attacks and additional damage from boosteds can critically strike. Garchomp's Critical-Hit rate increases at levels 5 and 9.

skills.name: Rough Skin
skills.description: When struck by a melee attack, a portion of the damage received is reflected back at the attacker.

rsb.name: Rough Skin
rsb.true_desc: When damaged by a nearby opposing Melee Pokémon, reflects 30% of the damage received back to that opposing Pokémon as Attack-based damage (2s CD).

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every fifth attack, dealing increased damage and restoring the user's HP. Every time a basic attack or move hits an enemy, basic attack speed is increased.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Gains 1 stack toward boosted attacks after hitting an auto attack or move, stacking up to 5 times. At 5 stacks, all basic attacks become boosted attacks with increased attack speed and additional 30% lifesteal, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon, and dealing an additional 10% remaining HP damage to them. All stacks decay after 4s of not hitting an auto attack or move.
rsb.notes: Against wild Pokémon: basic attack damage is capped at 1000; boosted attack damage is capped at 1100; additional remaining HP damage is capped at 350.

skills.name: Sand Attack
skills.description: Hurls sand, narrowing the field of vision of enemies and decreases their movement speed for a short time. Also increases movement speed and basic attack speed.

rsb.name: Sand Attack
rsb.true_desc: The user hurls sand in the designated direction, reducing the field of vision of opposing Pokémon by 50% and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s; increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2s and auto attack speed by 30% for 3s when this move hits.

upgrades.name: Dig
upgrades.description1: Burrow underground and move quickly in the designated direction, jumping out when coming in contact with an enemy or when traveling the maximum distance. This jump deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and throws them.
upgrades.description2: Damage received is reduced for a short time after jumping out of the ground.

rsb.name: Dig
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user digs underground, becoming untargetable while underground, and dashes quickly forward. The user then jumps out from underground beneath the first opposing Pokémon hit, after traveling max distance, or when coming into contact with an unpassable wall, increasing the user's Defense and Sp. Def for 4s, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and throwing them for 0.5s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Strengthens the duration of the throw to 1s.

upgrades.name: Dragon Rush
upgrades.description1: Back up to create distance before diving to attack in the designated direction, shoving enemies. The user can use Dragon Claw while creating distance at the start of this move to create a combo attack. (This move can crit)
upgrades.description2: Decreases the movement speed of enemies for a short time when they are shoved the maximum distance.

rsb.name: Dragon Rush
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user jumps back and briefly channels, reducing damage received by 30% for 0.9s, and dives forward, dragging all enemies within a small radius to the designated location, then damaging nearby opposing Pokémon afterward.
rsb.notes: The user can use Dragon Claw during the first half of the channel to add the Dragon Claw hits as a combo attack. This combo attack scoops up opposing Pokémon, dealing damage with both Dragon Rush and Dragon Claw's first attack and stunning them. If the combo attack hits, the user then throws opposing Pokémon back down with the second Dragon Claw attack, dealing damage with a strengthened slow.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Becomes unstoppable during this move; this includes the combo attack with Dragon Claw.

skills.name: Bulldoze
skills.description: Stomp down on the ground, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect.

rsb.name: Bulldoze
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user stomps down on the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

upgrades.name: Earthquake
upgrades.description1: Jump high into the air and crash forcefully to the ground, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect.
upgrades.description2: Decrease the movement speed of enemies for a short time if they are in this move's area of effect.

rsb.name: Earthquake
rsb.label: Damage - Initial
rsb.true_desc: The user jumps up and crashes forcefully to the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. Two aftershocks follow the initial crash, dealing less damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Strengthens the movement speed decrease of opposing Pokémon near the center of the crash to 40%.

upgrades.name: Dragon Claw
upgrades.description1: Attack twice in front of itself using its claws. The first attack deals damage to enemies and throws them. The second attack deals increased damage. After the move ends, basic attack speed is increased for a short time. (This move can crit)
upgrades.description2: Increase damage dealt.

rsb.name: Dragon Claw
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: The user charges in the designated direction viciously and attacks with two claw swipes. The first attack damages opposing Pokémon and shoves them in the designated direction. The second attack deals more damage to opposing Pokémon and decreases their movement speed by 45% for 2s.
rsb.notes: When this move is used in a combo attack with Dragon Rush, the movement speed decrease on the second attack is strengthened to 60% for 2s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage of both attacks.

skills.name: Livid Outrage
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Has the user unleash a powerful chain attack while dashing forward. The final attack throws enemies but also leaves the user unable to act for a short time.

rsb.name: Livid Outrage
rsb.label: Damage - First Hit
rsb.true_desc: The user goes berserk, becoming unstoppable and receiving 30% reduced damage for 5s while unleashing five powerful attacks in a row. The user dashes forward and damages opposing Pokémon in a unique designated area with each attack, taking a brief moment after each attack to aim the next dash. Every attack more damage than the last. The fifth attack throws opposing Pokémon hit and decreases their movement speed by 30% for 1s. The user is left confused for 0.5s afterward.

name: Gardevoir

builds.name: Psychic Shock
builds.explanation: Curse Incense may replace either Choice Specs or Wise Glasses based on what effects are desired. Energy Amplifier may replace the third item allowing for a focus on cooldown and unite usage.

builds.name: Future Moon
builds.explanation: Choice Specs assists in early game last hit before acquisition of Future Sight. Curse Incense may replace either Choice Specs or Wise Glasses based on what effects are desired. Energy Amplifier may replace the third item allowing for a focus on cooldown (more relevant for Moon Blast) and unite usage.

builds.name: Psyblast
builds.explanation: Wise Glasses will offer more damage accounting for AoE; Choice Specs has greater last hit utility; Curse Incense may replace either Choice Specs or Wise Glasses based on what effects are desired. Energy Amplifier as third item pushes the build towards a unite centric lower cooldown focus.

builds.name: Future Psychic
builds.explanation: Wise Glasses will offer more damage accounting for AoE; Choice Specs has greater last hit utility; Curse Incense may replace either Choice Specs or Wise Glasses based on what effects are desired. Energy Amplifier as third item pushes the build towards a unite centric lower cooldown focus.

notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Gardevoir has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels.

skills.name: Synchronize
skills.description: When an enemy inflicts decreased movement speed or a damge-over-time condition on the Pokémon, the same is inflicted on that opponent. This ability goes on cooldown after it's triggered.

rsb.name: Synchronize
rsb.label: Damage - DoT Applied (4x)
rsb.true_desc: When an opposing Pokémon decreases this Pokémon's movement speed, also decreases that opposing Pokémon's movement speed by 40% for 3s; or, when an opposing Pokémon inflicts a damage-over-time status condition on this Pokémon, also inflicts a damage-over time effect on that opposing Pokémon for 3s (8s CD).

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. When this boosted attack hits, it deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their Sp. Defense by 10% for a short time.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their Sp. Def by 10% for 2s.

skills.name: Confusion
skills.description: Attacks straight in the designated direction.

rsb.name: Confusion
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user fires a psychic bolt in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s.

upgrades.name: Psychic
upgrades.description1: After hitting an enemy or traveling its maximum distance, deals damage over time to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed and Sp. Defense by 20%, stacking up to 3 times.
upgrades.description2: Reduced cooldown.

rsb.name: Psychic
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user launches a psychic bolt in the designated direction which blasts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The blast creates a lingering field that slowly moves forward, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s (up to 5 hits). Each time this move hits opposing Pokémon, their Sp. Def is decreased by 25% for 4s (maximum 75%).
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

upgrades.name: Moonblast
upgrades.description1: Has the user attack while moving back to create distance. When the move's blast hits, it deals damage to enemies in a cone and leaves the enemy closest to the user unable to act for a short time.
upgrades.description2: Also grants a shield when this move is used.

rsb.name: Moonblast
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user dashes back slightly and launches a blast of moonlight in the designated direction which bursts into a cone behind the first opposing Pokémon hit, stunning that opposing Pokémon for 1.2s and damaging all opposing Pokémon in the cone area of effect, including the target.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Grants the user a shield for 3s when launching the blast.

skills.name: Teleport
skills.description: Has the user warp to the designated area, increasing the damage dealt by one basic attack after warping.

rsb.name: Teleport
rsb.true_desc: The user readies a boosted attack and warps forward to the designated location.
rsb.notes: When this move is learned, passively increases the damage of Synchronize, auto attacks, and Confusion by 15% until this move is replaced.

upgrades.name: Psyshock
upgrades.description1: Attacks the designated location three times. This move's cooldown is reduced each time one of these attacks hits an enemy.
upgrades.description2: Increase the damage this move deals each time one of its attacks hits.

rsb.name: Psyshock
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user channels at a designated area relative to their position before launching three attacks in succession, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and reducing the user's moves' cooldowns by 15% with each attack that hits.
rsb.notes: The user is able to attack and move freely while channeling this move.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage of the next attack to hit each time an attack hits an opposing Pokémon.

upgrades.name: Future Sight
upgrades.description1: Sets a delayed explosion. When the explosion hits an enemy, it reduces this move's cooldown.
upgrades.description2: Reset this move's cooldown when the explosion hits an enemy.

rsb.name: Future Sight
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user sets a delayed explosion at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon when the delayed explosion hits. If this move hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 75% and the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 1.5s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Resets this move's cooldown when it hits a Pokémon from the opposing team.

skills.name: Fairy Singularity
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Warps Space in the designated area, drawing in enemies to the center. Shoves and deals damage to enemies the instant the warped space disappears.

rsb.name: Fairy Singularity
rsb.label: Damage - Final Tick
rsb.true_desc: The user warps space in the designated area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and pulling them toward the center 4 times. As the warped space disappears, it deals increased damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoves them away from the center.

name: Gengar
notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Gengar has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels. At level 5, Gengar gains 12.5% spell vamp (restores HP when dealing Special Attack damage).

skills.name: Levitate
skills.description: Increases movement speed by 10% when out of combat. (5s after leaving combat)

rsb.name: Levitate
rsb.true_desc: When this Pokémon has not been in combat for 5s, their movement speed is increased by 10%.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an enemy and dealing damage.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon hit.

skills.name: Will-o-Wisp
skills.description: Shoot multiple sinister flames, dealing damage to enemies and leaving them burned when it hits.

rsb.name: Will-o-Wisp
rsb.label: Damage - First Flame
rsb.true_desc: The user shoots 3 sinister flames in a cone in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and burning them for 4s. The first flame deals full damage to each target hit; subsequent flames deal 50% of the full damage to the same target.
rsb.notes: The burn deals damage over time every 0.5s for 2s (dealing damage 3 times), and decreases Attack and Sp. Atk by 10% for 4s.

upgrades.name: Shadow Ball
upgrades.description1: Hurl a shadowy blob at the target, decreasing the movement speed and Sp. Defense of enemies for a short time when it hits.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage.

rsb.name: Shadow Ball
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user hurls a shadowy blob in the designated direction which stops at the first Pokémon from the opposing team hit, damaging opposing Pokémon hit, decreasing their movement speed by 90% for 1s, and decreasing their Sp. Def for 3s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage of this move.

upgrades.name: Sludge Bomb
upgrades.description1: Hurl unsanitary sludge to the designated area, leaving enemies poisoned when it hits.
upgrades.description2: Increased poison duration.

rsb.name: Sludge Bomb
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user hurls unsanitary sludge to the designated area, poisoning opposing Pokémon in the path of the hurl or in the designated area for 5s (dealing 1% max HP Sp. Atk-based damage every 0.5s; maximum 10%), and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect where the sludge lands.
rsb.notes: Against wild Pokémon: poison damage is capped at 120 per tick.
rsb.add1_true_desc: 1% Enemy Max HP every 0.5s (as special damage)
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Strengthens poison duration to 6s (dealing maximum 12% max HP Sp. Atk-based damage).

skills.name: Lick
skills.description: Attacks with the user's tongue and pulls enemies toward the user.

rsb.name: Lick
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user extends their tongue in the designated direction, stopping at the first opposing Pokémon hit, damaging the target and pulling them toward the user's location.
rsb.notes: The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.

upgrades.name: Dream Eater
upgrades.description1: Puts enemies to sleep when it hits. If used again while a nearby enemy is asleep, the user appears behind the target and attacks, restoring HP and reducing the cooldown of Shadow Ball or Sludge Bomb.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage and HP restored.

rsb.name: Dream Eater
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user projects a hypnotic orb in the designated direction, putting the first opposing Pokémon hit to sleep for 1s and applying a Dream Eater marker on them for 5s. If a nearby opposing Pokémon has a Dream Eater marker or else is asleep when the hypnotic orb disappears, this move can be used again within 5s. This second use has the user instantly teleport behind the target, damaging the target, restoring the user's HP, and reducing the cooldown of Will-O-Wisp, Shadow Ball, or Sludge Bomb by 2s.
rsb.notes: The user readies a boosted attack each time this move is used. If the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of this move is reset.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage dealt and HP restored by this move.

upgrades.name: Hex
upgrades.description1: Disappear and move to the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect when the user reappears. If this hits an enemy that is afflicted by a status condition, it deals increased damage and its cooldown is reduced.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage.

rsb.name: Hex
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user becomes invincible and vanishes, then reappears at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. If this move hits an opposing Pokémon afflicted by a status condition, the damage dealt to opposing Pokémon is doubled and the cooldown of this move is reduced by 90%.
rsb.notes: The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage of this move.

skills.name: Phantom Ambush
skills.buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Jump to the designated area and start sneaking with increased movement speed. If this move is used again, it deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time.

rsb.name: Phantom Ambush
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user becomes unstoppable as they jump forward to the designated location, then enters stealth and increases their movement speed by 30% for 7s. The user exits stealth when they use an attack. If this Unite Move is used again, the user becomes invincible as they jump out to attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1.5s when it hits.
rsb.notes: The user readies a boosted attack each time this move is used.

name: Glaceon

builds.name: Spear Shard
builds.explanation: Slick Spoon is stronger against bulkier opponents while Choice Specs is stronger against squishier opponents. Curse Incense can replace Slick Spoon, Choice Specs or Wise Glasses if enemy team has high sustain and no one else on the team has Curse effect.

builds.name: Freeze Wind
builds.explanation: This set cannot juggle permanently but can still maintain high ice crystal count through smart management. Offer's highest damage burst. Choice Specs assists in Freeze Dry and early game secure bursts. Wise Glasses priority over Choice Specs offers greater damage that relies less on Freeze Dry hitting priority targets.

notes: Auto attacks, Ice Shard, and Icy Wind can critically strike. Glaceon's Critical-Hit rate increases at levels 5 and 9. At level 4, Glaceon gains 12.5% spell vamp (restores HP when dealing Special Attack damage). When on a team with four other eeveelutions, gains +1% basic attack speed.

skills.name: Run Away
skills.description: When Eevee would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and becomes invincible for 1s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (70s cd).
skills.passive2_description: When Glaceon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated. Glaceon then starts sneaking and becomes invincible for 0.5s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (70s cd) and is reset after respawning.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and giving Glaceon 2 ice crystals when the boosted attack hits. Ice crystals last 5s and the duration is refreshed upon gaining additional crystals. Glaceon can hold a maximum of 8 ice crystals at a time.

skills.name: Swift
skills.description: Creates 4 stars around the user. For a short time afterward, each time the user hits an enemy with a basic attack, one of the stars (or 2 stars in the case of a boosted attack) will shoot out and deal additional damage to that enemy.

rsb.name: Swift
rsb.label: Damage - per Star
rsb.true_desc: Creates 4 stars around the user. For a short time afterward, each time the user hits an enemy with a basic attack or boosted attack, one or two of the stars respectively will shoot out and deal additional damage to the target.

upgrades.name: Icicle Spear
upgrades.description1: Has the user launch all of their stored ice crystals in rapid succession at the designated enemy. If no ice crystals are stored when this move is used, 2 ice crystals are instantly created and all crystals are launched. The crystals shatter when they hit the designated target, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. Launched ice crystals can hit enemies on the opposing team that are not the designated target of this move. If this occurs, the ice crystals will still shatter on impact and deal damage in an area in the same way. Ice crystals launched by this move deal increasing damage each time they hit the same enemy. After this move is used, the cooldown of Ice Shard or Freeze-Dry is reduced.
upgrades.description2: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to enemies hit, equal to a set percentage of their max HP.

rsb.name: Icicle Spear
rsb.label: Damage - per Ice Crystal
rsb.true_desc: Glaceon launches all of its stored ice crystals in rapid succession at the designated enemy. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, 2 ice crystals are instantly created and are launched. Launched ice crystals can hit enemies on the opposing team that are not the designated target of this move. The crystals shatter when they hit any enemy, dealing damage to all enemies in the area. Ice crystals launched by this move deal  5% increased damage each time they hit the same enemy (capped at 35%). When this move is used, Ice Shard's cooldown is reduced by 2s and Freeze Dry's cooldown is reduced by 2.5s. A maximum of 12 ice crystals may be launched.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to enemies hit equal to 0.5% of their remaining HP.
rsb.enhanced_notes: Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.

upgrades.name: Icy Wind
upgrades.description1: Jump a short distance in the designated direction. Glaceon's next basic attack launches all stored ice crystals at an enemy, dealing damage to them. Glaceon then regains the same number of ice crystals that were launched. If Glaceon hits the same enemy with 1 or more ice crystals, that enemies movement speed is decreased for a short time. The more ice crystals that hit that target, the stronger this movement speed-decrease effect. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, gain 2 ice crystals.
upgrades.description2: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to the enemy hit, equal to a set percentage of their max HP.

rsb.name: Icy Wind
rsb.label: Damage - per Ice Crystal
rsb.true_desc: Jump a short distance in the designated direction; Glaceon's next auto attack within 5s gains increased range and launches all stored ice crystals at an enemy, dealing damage to them. Glaceon then regains the same number of ice crystals that were launched. If an enemy is hit by 4 or more ice crystals, their movement speed is decreased by 8% per shard (stacking up to 6 times) for 1s. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, gain 2 ice crystals.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to enemies hit equal to 1.5% of their remaining HP.
rsb.enhanced_notes: Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.

skills.name: Tail Whip
skills.description: The user wags their tail at an enemy, dealing damage and decreasing their Defense, Sp. Def, and movement speed for a short time. The user's next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

rsb.name: Tail Whip
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Has the user wag its tail at an enemy, dealing damage and decreasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 30% for 2s, and movement speed by 20% for 1.5s. The next auto attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

upgrades.name: Ice Shard
upgrades.description1: Increase movement speed for a short time. Afterward, Glaceon's basic attack speed increases for a short time, and basic attacks change into attacks that hurl chunks of ice. These chunks of ice deal damage to enemies hit and decrease their movement speed for a short time. Every time a chunk of ice hits, the user gains 1 ice crystal. The user gains 2 ice crystals if this move is used while launching ice crystals with Icicle Spear, or if it's used after Icy Wind has been used, but before the user has launched all ice crystals with the next basic attack.
upgrades.description2: Also increases basic attack speed for the duration of this move's effect.

rsb.name: Ice Shard
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Glaceon gains an increase in movement speed by 40% for 1s while basic attack speed is increased by 60% for 2.5s. Basic attacks change into attacks that hurl chunks of ice for 2.5s. These chunks of ice deal damage to enemies they hit and decrease their movement speed by 30% for 1s. Each time a chunk of ice hits, Glaceon gains 2 ice crystals. If this move is used while launching crystals with Icicle Spear, or if this move is used after Icy Wind but before launching all crystals with the next auto attack, gain 2 ice crystals and increase Glaceon's movement speed by 50% for 0.5s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases basic attack speed further to 100% for 2.5s.

upgrades.name: Freeze Dry
upgrades.description1: Glaceon shoots out a freezing burst of air in a forward direction, increasing Sp. Atk for a short time. . This burst explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance; dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. For each enemy hit by the explosion, Glaceon gains 1 ice crystal. The explosion also leaves behind an ice zone. Enemies that enter this ice zone will have their movement speed decreased. If they remain in the ice zone for a set amount of time, they become frozen for a short time.
upgrades.description2: For each enemy hit by this move's explosions; gain 1 ice crystal.

rsb.name: Freeze Dry
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Shoot out a freezing burst of air in a forward direction. This burst explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance; dealing damage to all enemies in the area. Upon hitting an enemy, increase Glaceon's Sp. Atk by 50% for 3s. For each enemy hit by the explosion, Glaceon gains 2 ice crystals. The explosion also leaves behind an ice zone which slows enemies that enter by 30% for 3s. If they remain in the ice zone for 2.5s, they become frozen for 0.6s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: For each enemy hit by this move's explosions, Glaceon gains 1 additional ice crystal.

skills.name: Glacial Stage
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Leap up high, creating an ice zone in front of Glaceon that deals damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. While Glaceon is in the ice zone, movement speed is increased and Glaceon gains 1 ice crystal whenever a set amount of time passes. The movement speed of enemies in the ice zone is decreased.

rsb.name: Glacial Stage
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Glaceon leaps up high, creating an ice zone in front of themself that deals damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. While Glaceon is in the ice zone, their movement speed is increased by 50% for 6s, and Glaceon gains 1 ice crystals every second while in the zone. The movement speed of enemies in the ice zone is decreased by 50% for 2s.

name: Goodra

builds.name: Muddy Whip
builds.explanation: Path Tank must run EXP share and emblem loadout 2; For Muscle Band use emblem loadout 1. Focus Band may be used instead of Resonant Guard for non tank build.

builds.name: Muddy Spray
builds.explanation: Emphasis on using Unite as recovery. Emblemed for attack speed to balance out the loss in attack speed item.

builds.name: Dragon Spray
builds.explanation: Path Tank must run EXP share and emblem loadout 2; For Muscle Band use emblem loadout 1. Focus Band may be used instead of Resonant Guard for non tank build.

notes: Only auto attacks and additional damage from boosteds can critically strike, but Goodra has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels.

rsb.name: Gooey
rsb.label: Damage (Slime)
rsb.true_desc: When this Pokémon is hit by an attack, there is a chance it will spread slime around itself. The slime deals damage to Pokémon, Decreases their attack speed by 50% for 2s and applies a Gooey debuff. The Gooey debuff slows Pokémon by 10% for 6s and can stack up to 4 times per Pokémon. Gooey is a debuff that is applicable to Wild Pokémon and enemy players only.
rsb.notes: When this Pokémon enters tall grass, it continually recovers HP for up to 3s, until it leaves the tall grass, uses a move, or attacks. When this Pokémon recovers HP due to Gooey, its attack gauge is progressed towards a boosted attack. This HP recovery goes on a 12s cooldown after being triggered.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Hitting a Pokémon afflicted with a Gooey effect with a basic attack reduces all of this Pokémon's move cooldowns by 1.5s.
rsb.notes: Boosted attacks spew slime and if the slime hits Pokémon from a distance, a Gooey debuff is applied to those Pokémon and slows by 50% for 0.5s. If the boosted attack is used on a Pokémon in regular attack melee range, the attack deals increased damage.

boosted_rsb.name: Boosted
boosted_rsb.label: Damage - Boosted
boosted_rsb.add1_true_desc: 3% Max HP damage (Capped at 500 on Wild Pokémon)

rsb.name: Bubble
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Cover itself in a bubble, granting it a shield for 3s. When the shield’s effect duration ends or if this move is used again, the bubble shield pops, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and slowing them by 30% for 2s.

rsb.name: Muddy Water
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Splashes muddy water around itself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and applying an effect to them that decreases the amount of damage they deal by 15% for 3s. If the user deals damage to opposing Pokémon with this move, the user’s Defense and Sp. Def are increased for 2s. If Muddy Water is used within 6 seconds, the defense bonus effect is increased in intensity. The defenses bonus effect can stack up to four times.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Further increases the user’s Defense and Sp. Def when this move deals damage to opposing Pokémon.

rsb.name: Dragon Pulse
rsb.label: Damage (Center - per hit up to 4 hits)
rsb.true_desc: Unleashes a shock wave in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits up to 4 times. If the center of the shock wave hits enemy Pokémon, it deals increased damage to them and restores the user’s HP. More HP is restored when the center of the pulse deals damage to enemy Pokémon that have a Gooey slowing effect applied to them.
rsb.notes: The fourth tick of damage can be animation cancelled by inputs (attack or movement). It is undetermined if this is a bug or not.
rsb.add1_label: Damage (Side - per hit up to 4 hits)
rsb.add2_label: Healing (Per hit up to 4x based on number of Center hits)
rsb.add3_label: Healing (Gooey Center- Per hit up to 4x based on number of Center hits)
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Restores more HP if the center of the shock wave hits Pokémon, and even more on Pokémon that have a Gooey debuff applied to them.
rsb.enhanced_add1_label: Healing (Per hit up to 4x based on number of Center hits)
rsb.enhanced_add2_label: Healing (Gooey Center- Per hit up to 4x based on number of Center hits)

rsb.name: Tackle
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Charges at a Pokémon, dealing damage and throwing it. If this move hits, the user bounces back a short distance.

rsb.name: Power Whip
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Lashes out with its horns in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon in the area of effect and slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move hits distant Pokémon, those Pokémon are pulled toward Goodra.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Also applies a Gooey effect when this move hits.

rsb.name: Acid Spray
rsb.label: Damage (Initial)
rsb.true_desc: Spits acidic fluid at target Pokémon, dealing damage to Pokémon in an area of effect centered on the target slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move is used again, Goodra charges in the designated direction and deals damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. If this charge hits a Pokémon that has been marked by acidic fluid, that Pokémon is thrown for 0.75s, and damage is also dealt to nearby opposing Pokémon.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Also applies a Gooey effect to opposing Pokémon that receive damage from either the acidic fluid or the charge.

skills.name: Right as Rain
skills.buffs: 40% Max HP Shield, 50% Movement Speed

rsb.name: Right as Rain
rsb.label: Healing (13 ticks)
rsb.true_desc: Causes rain to fall around the user, gradually restoring the user’s HP over 6s. While this move is active, all of the user’s basic attacks become boosted attacks.

name: Greedent

builds.name: Bullet Stuff
builds.explanation: Full Heal may be considered to get out of tougher situations.

notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Greedent has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels.

skills.name: Cheek Pouch
skills.description: When Greedent eats a berry, recover HP after receiving the effects of the berry. At the same time, Greedent stashes another berry in its tail. Being hit by a single attack or combination of attacks will cause a berry to drop from Greedent's tail.

rsb.name: Cheek Pouch
rsb.true_desc: When Greedent eats a berry, recover HP after receiving the effects of the berry (oran berry or unite move berry 1%Max HP + 3x(Lv-1) + 23; sitrus or salac berry 1%Max HP + 0x(Lv-1) + 23). At the same time, Greedent stashes an Oran berry in its tail. Being hit by a single attack or combination of attacks will cause an Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail (4.5s cd). Berries stay on the ground for 10s.
rsb.notes: All players heal from an oran berry for 2% Max HP + 5x(Level-1) + 45, level and Max HP scaling is based on the player that ate the oran berry.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits and causing one berry to drop from Greedent's tail.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits and causing one Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail.

skills.name: Tackle
skills.description: Leap to the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed for a short time. If this move is used while Covet is active, no area can be designated for the user to leap to. Instead, while the user is running, damage is dealt in an area to enemies in front of Greedent. If Greedent has any berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Tackle's cooldown for each berry consumed.

rsb.name: Tackle
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Leap to the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 1s. If this move is used while Covet is active, no area can be designated for Greedent to leap to. Instead, while running, damage is dealt in an area to enemies in front of Greedent. If Greedent has any Oran berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Tackle's cooldown by 1s for each berry consumed.

upgrades.name: Bullet Seed
upgrades.description1: Spit berry seeds in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed for a short time. The more berries Greedent has stashed, the more damage this move deals.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage.

rsb.name: Bullet Seed
rsb.label: Damage - per Seed
rsb.true_desc: Spit berry seeds in the designated direction for 6s; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s. Greedent fires more seeds for each Oran berry stashed.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increased damage.

upgrades.name: Belch
upgrades.description1: Deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed for a short time. If Greedent has any berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Belch's cooldown for each berry consumed.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage.

rsb.name: Belch
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed by 40% for 2s, decreasing by 10% every 0.5s. If Greedent has any Oran berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Belch's cooldown by 1s for each berry consumed (capping at 4s). This move's cooldown cannot be reduced beyond 1s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increased damage.

skills.name: Defense Curl
skills.description: Grants Greedent a shield for a short time. In addition, a berry will drop in front of Greedent.

rsb.name: Defense Curl
rsb.true_desc: Grants Greedent a shield (10% max HP) for 3s. In addition, an Oran berry will drop in front of Greedent.

upgrades.name: Stuff Cheeks
upgrades.description1: Greedent drops several berries, which can be eaten to recover HP. Any HP recovered that exceeds Greedent's max HP will be converted to a shield. If Greedent catches sight of a berry while using this move, movement speed is increased for a short time.
upgrades.description2: Increase the number of berries dropped.

rsb.name: Stuff Cheeks
rsb.true_desc: Greedent drops 5 Oran berries, which can be eaten to recover HP. Any HP recovered from an Oran berry eaten within 5s that exceeds Greedent's max HP will be converted to a shield for 1.8% max HP per berry (capped at 9% max HP or 5 berries). If Greedent catches sight of a berry while using this move, movement speed is increased by 70% for 6s, but decreasing by 15% every 1s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increase the number of Oran berries dropped by 1.

upgrades.name: Covet
upgrades.description1: Greedent runs with all its might, becoming unstoppable and dealing damage to enemies hit and throwing them. While running, Greedent drops berries. Eating a dropped berry increases movement speed for a short time. The more berries eaten, the more movement speed is increased. In addition, Belch or Bullet Seed can also be used while running.
upgrades.description2: Increased damage dealt and increased frequency of berries dropping.

rsb.name: Covet
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Greedent runs with all its might for 6s; becoming resistant to hindrances (for 6.1s), dealing damage to enemies hit and throwing them. While running; Greedent drops Oran berries every 1s. Eating a dropped berry increases movement speed by 22% for 1s (stacking up to 5 times). In addition, Tackle, Belch or Bullet Seed can also be used while running and using this move will reset the cooldown of Tackle or Belch.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increased damage and increased frequency of Oran berries dropping (8 berries over 6s).

skills.name: Berry Belly Flop
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Greedent eats a berry to recover HP and then leaps to the designated area, dealing damage and throwing enemies within the area of effect. Greedent then eats a special berry, allowing an unlimited amount of berries to be stored for a short time and resets cooldowns of all moves.

rsb.name: Berry Belly Flop
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Greedent eats a special berry to recover 15% max HP and then leaps to the designated area; dealing damage and throwing enemies within the area of effect. Greedent then eats another berry, allowing an unlimited amount of Oran berries to be stored for 8s and resets cooldowns of all moves. Greedent is unstoppable during this move.

name: Greninja

builds.name: Surf Screen
builds.explanation: Emphasize ranged attacks to lower into Surf reset range and being slightly safer. Energy Amplifier may be used as a third item instead for a unite-centric play pattern.

builds.name: Surf Screen (All-in)
builds.explanation: Emphasizes using Smokescreen+, X-Attack then Unite

notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike. Greninja's Critical-Hit rate increases at levels 5 and 9.

skills.name: Torrent
skills.description: While HP is at 50% or less, Attack and movement speed are increased.

rsb.name: Torrent
rsb.true_desc: While at 50% max HP or below, increases Attack by 5% and movement speed by 12%.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. At long range, a boosted attack deals increased damage to enemies and decreases their movement speed for a short time. At close range, a boosted attack deals more damage the lower the enemies remaining HP is.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Auto attacks differ depending on range, and become boosted attacks with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Auto attacks used at long range reduce the cooldown of Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf by 0.5s when they hit. Boosted attacks used at long range also decrease the movement speed of the opposing Pokémon hit by 25% for 0.5s.
rsb.notes: Auto attacks used in close range instead deal a bonus 5% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit. Boosted attacks used in close range dash through the target, dealing a bonus 10% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit instead. Against wild Pokémon: the total damage of auto attacks used in close range is capped at 500.

skills.name: Bubble
skills.description: Attack with a spray of bubbles, decreasing the movement speed of enemies when it hits.

rsb.name: Bubble
rsb.label: Damage - per Hit (2 Hits)
rsb.true_desc: Sprays 2 bubbles in the designated direction which pop when they hit an opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when each bubble hits.

upgrades.name: Water Shuriken
upgrades.description1: Throw shurikens made of water in quick succession. Decreases the movement speed of enemies for a short time and restores the user's HP when it hits. Also increases the user's movement speed while using this move.
upgrades.description2: Increases the number of shurikens thrown.

rsb.name: Water Shuriken
rsb.label: Damage - per Shuriken
rsb.true_desc: Increases movement speed by 25% for 3s and throws 4 shurikens made of water in the designated direction which explode when they hit an opposing Pokémon, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s when each shuriken hits; and restoring HP for each opposing Pokémon hit.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Throws 5 shurikens.

upgrades.name: Surf
upgrades.description1: Ride a wave, dealing damage to enemies and restoring the user's HP. If this move knocks out an enemy, its cooldown is reset. In addition, this move deals increased damage to enemies with low HP.
upgrades.description2: Increases the amount of HP restored.

rsb.name: Surf
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Dashes on a wave forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and restoring HP for each target hit. Deals bonus damage to opposing Pokémon below 50% max HP. If this move hits and the user knocks out an opposing Pokémon before it goes on cooldown, the cooldown of this move is reset.
rsb.notes: Against wild Pokémon: the damage of the wave is capped at 1200; bonus damage is capped at 600.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the HP restored by this move.

skills.name: Substitute
skills.description: Leaves behind a substitute doll for the user while it's moving forward.

rsb.name: Substitute
rsb.true_desc: Becomes invincible and dashes forward, leaving behind a Substitute doll in their place which lasts for 3s.
rsb.notes: The Substitute doll has the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as the user; the Substitute doll receives 500% of the damage the user would take.

upgrades.name: Double Team
upgrades.description1: Quickly moves the user away from the current position, creating illusory copies of it to aid in battle.
upgrades.description2: Reduced cooldown.

rsb.name: Double Team
rsb.true_desc: Briefly vanishes then becomes unstoppable and dashes forward, sending two illusionary copies diagonally behind which last for 3s.
rsb.notes: The copies have the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as Greninja when created, but receive 500% of the damage they would otherwise take. The clones attack nearby opposing Pokémon with Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf (whichever move the user has learned), and auto attacks; but deal 19.44% of the damage they would otherwise deal.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

upgrades.name: Smokescreen
upgrades.description1: Creates a smokescreen and has the user roll away from its current location. Immediately afterward, the user begins sneaking and has its movement speed increased for a short time. This also makes its next basic attack a boosted attack.
upgrades.description2: Increased attack for a short time when the user stops sneaking.

rsb.name: Smokescreen
rsb.label: Damage - Boosted (Replacement)
rsb.true_desc: Becomes unstoppable and dashes forward, increasing their movement speed by 10% for 2s, entering stealth for 2s, readying a boosted attack that deals increased damage, and leaving behind a cloud of smoke which lasts for 3s. Exits stealth when using an attack.
rsb.notes: Opposing Pokémon in the cloud of smoke have their field of vision reduced by 60%.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases Attack by 20% for 2s when exiting stealth.

skills.name: Waterburst Shuriken
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield
skills.description: Throw a giant water shuriken toward the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed for a short time when this move hits. The water shuriken then immediately explodes, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and throws them. Once this move ends, the user may jump in a designated direction.

rsb.name: Waterburst Shuriken
rsb.label: Damage (2x)
rsb.true_desc: Becomes unstoppable and leaps up to throw a giant water shuriken toward the designated circular location, damaging opposing Pokémon it hits on the way to the circular area of effect (from beyond the range of the user's close range auto attacks) and decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50% for 2s. The user then suddenly appears on top of the water shuriken which immediately bursts, damaging opposing Pokémon in the circular area of effect again and throwing them.
rsb.notes: Leaps off the burst water shuriken and becomes vulnerable to hindrances again as they jump down to the ground in the direction of their choosing.

name: Gyarados
notes: Magikarp may evolve earlier than level 7 if their effort gauge is filled. Both Moves may be learned upon evolution. Only auto attacks can critically strike. Gyarados' Critical-Hit rate increases at levels 5 and 9. Magikarp has a locked attack speed that cannot be changed by held items, battle items or moves. Gyarados' attack speed is affected by held items, battle items and moves.

skills.name: Rattled
skills.description: When damaged, increases movement speed by 5% for 3s (up to 5 times; maximum 25%).
skills.passive2_description: When knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team or making an assist, reduces current move cooldowns by 30%.

rsb.name: Rattled
rsb.true_desc: When damaged, increases movement speed by 5% for 3s (up to 5 times; maximum 25%).
rsb.notes: Increases the effort gauge each time Magikarp uses an auto attack or move, hits with an auto attack or move, scores a goal, knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team or assists in knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team. Once the effort gauge is full, Magikarp evolves into Gyarados.

rsb2.name: Moxie
rsb2.true_desc: When knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team or making an assist, reduces current move cooldowns by 30%.
rsb2.notes: Gyarados passively gains bonus 1200 HP, 100 Attack, and 40% basic attack speed until the end of the battle; these stats are not affected by boost emblem color bonuses.

skills.name: Attack - Magikarp
skills.basic2_description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Magikarp has no boosted attack.
rsb.notes: Magikarp's basic attacks are a set animation length.

rsb.name: Flail
rsb.label: Damage - Above 66% HP
rsb.true_desc: Flails on the spot, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon; damage strengthens for every 33% max HP the user is missing.

rsb.name: Dragon Breath
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them for 3s when it hits, decreasing their movement speed and basic attack speed by 30%.
rsb.notes: If this move hits, gains a buff for 5s; increasing the range and damage of auto attacks; and increasing basic attack speed by a minimum of 40%, strengthening by 15% for each additional opposing Pokémon hit (up to 2 times; maximum 70%).
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage dealt by this move and enhanced auto attacks.

rsb.name: Aqua Tail
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: For up to 4s while this move is held; moves slightly in the designated direction then swings a blade of water from their tail in the designated direction (up to 5 times), damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each blade.
rsb.notes: If at least 3 blades of water hit opposing Pokémon before this move is released or ends, a second stage of this move can be used within 5s; becomes unstoppable and charges for up to 1.5s, then attacks with a large sweep of their tail in a wider area forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. If the second stage is charged for at least 0.5s, increases the range of the area of effect and damage dealt.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the damage of the first use of this move.
rsb.enhanced_notes: The second stage of this move deals an additional 15% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1000.

rsb.name: Splash
rsb.true_desc: Jumps to the designated location forward.
rsb.notes: A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 2s cooldown between uses.

rsb.name: Waterfall
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Charges forward up to 3 times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each charge; waiting for at least 0.07s before dashing forward with the next charge. The first charge is a regular dash forward; the next movement within 2s after the last charge dashes forward with the same effect. Dragon Breath or Aqua Tail can be used within the 2s duration in between charges without interrupting this move's course. Using Dragon Current ends this move early.
rsb.notes: If two charges hit opposing Pokémon, grants a shield for 2s. If all three charges hit opposing Pokémon, the third charge throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Reduce this move's cooldown by 1s.

rsb.name: Bounce
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Becomes unstoppable and charges power for up to 2.4s, becoming fully charged after 0.8s; then bounces to the designated location forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area upon impact. While charging power, increases the range of this move, reaching maximum range when fully charged.
rsb.notes: If fully charged when released, grants a shield for 3s, and throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s. If this move is canceled, it goes on a 2s cooldown.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Strengthens the value of the shield effect.

skills.name: Dragon Current
skills.buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

rsb.name: Dragon Current
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Becomes untargetable and dives underwater for up to 4s while this Unite Move is held, increasing movement speed by 45%. When released or after 4s, forcefully leaps up and attacks, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.
rsb.notes: If the user stays underwater for at least 1s before releasing the Unite Move, strengthens to movement speed increase to 55%; deals increased damage and creates a whirlpool where they surface, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (up to 5 times) and decreasing their movement speed for 4s when hit. If underwater for at least 2s, strengthens the movement speed increase to 65%; deals even more damage and creates a waterspout where they surface instead, throwing opposing Pokémon hit for 0.96s.

name: Ho-Oh
notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Ho-Oh has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels.

rsb.name: Regenerator
rsb.true_desc: If this Pokémon doesn't take damage from enemy Pokémon (Wild Pokémon do not count) for 3s, it will recover 3% max HP every 2 seconds. Damage to shields will not deactivate Regenerator. Ho-oh additionally recovers 0.3% max HP every 2 seconds.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting out a sweeping flame that deals increased damage and restores HP per enemy Pokémon hit. While firing the sweeping flame Ho-Oh's movement speed is decreased by 30%.

rsb.name: Safeguard
rsb.true_desc: Create a protective field around the user that reduces the next incoming source of damage by 50%. When this field reduces damage from an attack, the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s.

rsb.name: Fly
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: The user begins flying high above the map for up to 8s. The next 3 basic attacks are boosted attacks. While flying, the user is able to move freely over walls and its attack and movement speed are increased by 30%. If this move is used again, the user lands dealing damage to opposing Pokémon around the landing zone and cancelling the attack and movement speed bonuses.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the flight time by 4s.

rsb.name: Fire Spin
rsb.true_desc: Generate a blazing vortex around yourself and gain a shield. While the vortex is active, Ho-Oh slows itself by 40% and cannot attack. The first time an enemy interacts with the vortex, they receive an 80% movement speed decrease decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 4s. The vortex also deals damage to enemies. If allies are within the vortex, 50% of post-mitigation damage those allies would take is redirected to Ho-Oh as true damage (without ignoring shields).
rsb.notes: If there is a shield after 4s or if this move is used again while this move's shield is intact, a heat wave is released around the user, dealing damage to enemies, and additional damage equal to the percentage of the damage the shield received. There is a 1.5s delay before the shield may be detonated from the start of the vortex. If the shield is destroyed before detonation, no damage is dealt.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: When the shield is broken, the heat wave is now automatically released.

rsb.name: Tailwind
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Whip up a whirlwind in designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit. The whirlwind then remains on the field for 5s. Allies moving in the same direction as the whirlwind have thier movement speed increased by 30% as long as they are in the field and lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field. Opposing Pokémon moving against the whirlwind have their movement speed decreased by 30% lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field.

rsb.name: Flamethrower
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Blow flames in a designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit every 0.25s and slowing Ho-Oh's movement speed by 15%. This move may be held for up to 4s to blow flames for longer. This move's cooldown increases the longer flames are blown for. If enemies are hit, the user recovers HP. If enemies are hit thrice, they are burned, refreshing on additional hits of flamethrower.
rsb.notes: Burned enemies take damage over 3s at 0.5s intervals. Burned enemies also have their movement speed decreased by 15% for 1.5s, their attack decreased by 20% for 2s, and their special attack decreased by 20% for 1.5s. Enemies burned by Flamethrower will leave behind a scorched area. Enemies traversing the scorched area are slowed by 15%. Enemies that touch the area will also receive burns but this burn will not spread the scorched area.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: Increases the length of time flames may be blown to 5s.

rsb.name: Sky Attack
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Ho-Oh spreads their wings and charges in a loop. While charging, deal damage to enemies hit and burn the ground along the flight path for 4.5s. The burning ground deals damage to enemies that touch it every 0.5s and slows them by 30% for 1.5s. If this move is used again or if another move is used mid-charge, then the user stops in place.
rsb.notes: During the flight, Ho-Oh receives 30% less damage.
rsb.enhanced_true_desc: While the Ho-Oh is on burning ground, gradually restore HP.

skills.name: Rekindling Flame
skills.buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

rsb.name: Rekindling Flame
rsb.true_desc: When a nearby ally is knocked out, a feather is left in their place until they respawn at base. When Rekindling Flame is used, Ho-oh spreads their wings and consumes all of the Aeos energy held to revive knocked-out allies where their feathers are for 60% of their maximum HP. Rekindling Flame may only be used if there are feathers nearby. The number of available revivals are based on how much Aeos energy is consumed. One ally may be always revived. Up to two allies are revivable if at least 9 energy is consumed. Up to three allies are revivable if at least 17 Aeos energy is consumed. Up to four allies are revivable if at least 25 Aeos energy is consumed.

name: Hoopa

builds.name: Hyperspace Force
builds.explanation: Curse Incense may be used to have anti-heal for your team.

builds.name: Shadow Trick
builds.explanation: Curse Incense may be used to have anti-heal for your team.

builds.name: Phantom Trick
builds.explanation: Curse Incense may be used to have anti-heal for your team.

notes: Only auto attacks can critically strike, but Hoopa has 0% base Critical-Hit rate at all levels.

skills.name: Magician
skills.description: In battles where the map is divided into an ally team side and an opposing team side, this ability creates a hole under one of the berries on the opposing team's side (chosen at random) and warps it in front of Hoopa. If there are no berries, but there is Aeos Energy on the ground, then some energy is warped in front of Hoopa instead. In the event that no berries from the opposing team's side are warped, the cooldown of this ability is reduced.

rsb.name: Magician
rsb.true_desc: In battles where the map is divided into an ally team side and an opposing team side, this ability creates a hole under one of the berries on the opposing team's side (chosen at random) and warps it in front of Hoopa (40s cooldown). If there are no berries, but there is Aeos Energy on the ground, then some energy is warped in front of Hoopa instead. In the event that no berries from the opposing team's side are warped, the cooldown of this ability is reduced to 20s. Berries last 30 seconds and take 2 seconds to appear after magician's activation.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies by unleashing a beam of light. When Hoopa is unbound, every attack becomes a boosted attack and deals damage to up to 2 additional nearby enemies.

rsb.name: Basic
rsb.label: Damage - Basic
rsb.true_desc: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies by unleashing a beam of light.

skills.name: Astonish
skills.description: Deals damage to enemies in the designated area of effect, leaving them unable to act for a short time.

rsb.name: Astonish
rsb.label: Damage
rsb.true_desc: Deals damage to enemies in the designated area of effect, leaving them unable to act for .75s.

upgrades.name: Phantom Force
upgrades.description1: Hoopa creates a portal ring under itself and warps to a designated location, dealing damage to nearby enemies at that location and shoving them.
